intro: Hypocyrta villosa, commonly known as the hairy hypocris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Hypocyrta villosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forest understory environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
